topic.title: HPE Helion 2.0 Development Platform: ALS Command Reference: Buildpacks

ul.li: helion buildpacks: Show all buildpacks known to the target in the order they are checked in during auto-detection.
helion create-buildpack: Add a buildpack to the target.
helion delete-buildpack: Remove the specified buildpack from the target.
helion rename-buildpack: Change the name of the specified buildpack.
helion update-buildpack: Change the information known about the specified buildpack.

section.title: Syntax
section.p: For more information, use the helion help or helion help [command] commands.

section.title: helion buildpacks
section.p: Show all buildpacks known to the target in the order they are checked in during auto-detection.

row.entry: Print raw json as output, not human-formatted data.
The once-off target to use for the current operation.
The once-off authentication token to use for the current operation.
Path to an existing and readable file containing the targets and authorization tokens.

section.title: helion create-buildpack <name> <zip>
section.p: Add a buildpack to the target.

row.entry: Disable the buildpack, preventing its use.
Location of the buildpack in the sequence used to check them during auto-detection.
The once-off target to use for the current operation.
The once-off authentication token to use for the current operation.
Path to an existing and readable file containing the targets and authorization tokens.
Unlock the buildpack, allow changes again.

section.title: helion delete-buildpack <name>
section.p: Remove the specified buildpack from the target.

row.entry: The once-off target to use for the current operation.
The once-off authentication token to use for the current operation.
Path to an existing and readable file containing the targets and authorization tokens.

section.title: helion rename-buildpack <name> <newname>
section.p: Change the name of the specified buildpack.

row.entry: The once-off target to use for the current operation.
The once-off authentication token to use for the current operation.
Path to an existing and readable file containing the targets and authorization tokens.

section.title: helion update-buildpack <name>
section.p: Change the information known about the specified buildpack.

row.entry: Disable the buildpack, preventing its use.
Location of the buildpack in the sequence used to check them during auto-detection.
The once-off target to use for the current operation.
The once-off authentication token to use for the current operation.
Path to an existing and readable file containing the targets and authorization tokens.
Unlock the buildpack, allow changes again.
Path or url of the new zip file containing the implementation of the buildpack. Accepts the path to a local directory as well, which will become the zip file to upload.
